def_en: If something confirms what you believe, suspect, or fear, it shows that it is definitely true.
If you confirm something that has been stated or suggested, you say that it is true because you know about it.

def_cn: (通常指通过信件或电话)确定，确认(安排或预约)
def_en: If you confirm an arrangement or appointment, you say that it is definite, usually in a letter or on the telephone.

def_cn: 为…施坚振礼（或坚信礼）(从而正式成为基督教会的成员)
def_en: If someone is confirmed, they are formally accepted as a member of a Christian church during a ceremony in which they say they believe what the church teaches.

def_cn: 使坚定，使确信(自己的决定、信仰或观点)
def_en: If something confirms you in your decision, belief, or opinion, it makes you think that you are definitely right.

def_cn: 加强，巩固(地位、角色或权力)
def_en: If someone confirms their position, role, or power, they do something to make their power, position, or role stronger or more definite.

def_cn: 巩固，确保(某人的名声、角色或地位)
def_en: If something confirms you as something, it shows that you definitely deserve a name, role, or position.
